p: Swiss albino mice of either sex (n=120) were selected for all the four experiments. The animals were indiscriminately distributed into 5 groups, each comprising 6 animals. Group I received distilled water as a negative control. While the test groups, Group II, Group III and Group IV received 100mg/kg, 200mg/kg and 400mg/kg of the test substance, respectively. The concentrations were selected according to acute toxicity study results conducted elsewhere. 13 Group V assigned as a positive control received the standard drugs. This grouping was used for all the four experiments. Morphine (10 mg/kg, s.c.) was used for hot plate method. While aspirin 150 mg/kg was used for acetic acid induced writhing test, carrageenan and formaldehyde induced paw edema. Oral route was used to deliver all the drugs using entragastric gavage.
